>>38010128

Tatsumaki's up next, and you go in at her side. There's no way you'll be able to land a hit on this guy alone, not wielding this sword the way you are. You mull over tactics for a split-second. You'll have to trick him into your path. Get him when he's rolling and can't move another way, or have an ally back you up. But how can you force someone like this to give up ground?

The cat-eared brawler barely ducks a swing of his sword, and a snap kick knocks her clean out of the way. He goes low, and begins to focus, taking that same spell-casting gesture as before. Nel and Donnel are strafing slowly from his sides, waiting for an opening.

"Alright, then. I've had a good time, but I'd prefer we settle this another day--on even terms." Anaximander says. "If you'll excuse me..."

Nowhere to go. You come in with the overhead swing, and for the first time, he looks surprised, raising his sword to parry and bracing it with one hand.
